summary: The National Prescribed Fire Act of 2025 aims to expand the use of prescribed fire on federal lands, particularly in the western and southeastern United States. It directs the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture to encourage and support prescribed fire, including cultural burning by Indigenous communities. The bill outlines funding mechanisms, establishes a collaborative program for prescribed fire projects, and addresses workforce development and training. It also includes provisions for environmental review, smoke management, and reporting on implementation progress.
